bibl.title: Letter, Southgate Cregmile in Nashville, Tenn. to Mother, 1862, December 8
bibl.note: 1862 December 6 Southgate Cregmile in Nashville, Tenn., to his Mother (Eleanor Griffin). Greets his mother with the fact that presently everyone there is well and hopes she is the same. Very excited that they were just paid for four months service and will be paid the remainder owed them in January. Tells her about two military officers visiting their camp and about nine new recruits.

div.p: I took my pen in hand to rite you a few lines to let you know that we are all well at presant and hope that you are the same. the boys are a having a good time now sence thay were payde off we were payde of for four months the same day that the

Col started home we are a going to payde the first of January for the rest. I wount have mutch to send home this time Alexander mongomery and John Bresler was here to day. there were nine new recruts come in our company to day from Butler Co I hafft to stop riting to day for I cant think of anything new I will rite more some other day we are still at Nashville
